snippet: Bike New York hopes to avoid paying nearly $1 million meant to compensate the city for shutting down roadways for the event.
abstract: Bike New York, nonprofit group that organizes annual 40-mile ride around New York City, files suit to avoid nearly $1 million in fees for traffic control by New York Police Department; legal challenge is first since rule change took effect in 2011 meant to offset high costs of shutting down traffic for popular athletic events.
lead_paragraph: Bike New York hopes to avoid paying nearly $1 million meant to compensate the city for shutting down roadways for the event.

headline.seo: Bike New York Files Suit Over Traffic Charges
headline.main: Bike Tour Files Suit to Avoid Traffic Fees
headline.print_headline: Bike Tour Files Suit To Avoid Traffic Fees
